title.native: 輪廻のラグランジェ season 2
title.english: Lagrange: The Flower of Rin-ne Season 2

description:
Several months have passed since Lan and Muginami left Earth. Now in her final year of high school, Madoka spends most of her days thinking about her friends, when Lan suddenly returns to Kamogawa City.

(Source: VIZ Media)

node.description:
__Blood Type:__ A
__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")
__Hobby:__ Collecting records, watching professional wrestling
__Agency:__ Stay Luck

[Profile](https://stay-luck.com/talent/nakajima-megumi) | [Website](https://nakajima-megumi.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mamegu_staff) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkOGw3UbTMkj8U0VYzdmi5A) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/24277.html)

Born of a Japanese father and a Filipino mother, Megumi was brought up in a "house filled with music" and grew up with the desire to sing.  In 2003, she participated in the "Self Stardust Promotion" contest and passed, thereby affiliating her to the agency. In 2007, she auditioned to the Victor Entertainment sanctioned "Victor Vocal & Voice Audition" and won the role to voice Ranka Lee in Macross Frontier.  She is also the voice provider for the Vocaloid, [Megpoid](https://anilist.co/staff/140519).

She is affiliated with Stay Luck for voice acting and FlyingDog for singing.

[Profile](https://stay-luck.com/talent/nakajima-megumi) | [Website](https://nakajima-megumi.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mamegu_staff) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkOGw3UbTMkj8U0VYzdmi5A) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/24277.html)

Born of a Japanese father and a Filipino mother, Megumi was brought up in a "house filled with music" and grew up with the desire to sing.  In 2003, she participated in the "Self Stardust Promotion" contest and passed, thereby affiliating her to the agency. In 2007, she auditioned to the Victor Entertainment sanctioned "Victor Vocal & Voice Audition" and won the role to voice Ranka Lee in Macross Frontier.  She is also the voice provider for the Vocaloid, [Megpoid](https://anilist.co/staff/140519).

She is affiliated with Stay Luck for voice acting and FlyingDog for singing.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/116444028) | [Website](http://www.dragon-brave.com)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/morio_san) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/688436)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__Height:__ 153cm

[Profile (Style Cube)](http://stylecube.jp/talents/kaori/index.html) | [Website](http://ishiharakaori.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaori_staff_) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/ishiharakaori/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ishiharakaori_official) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@kaori_ishihara)

She won the award of Best Rookie Actress in the 7th Seiyuu Awards. She was a founding member of the group [StylipS](https://anilist.co/staff/111177), before her graduation from the group on April 20, 2013. She was one half of J-Pop duo [YuiKaori](https://anilist.co/staff/195974/), along with [Yui Ogura](https://anilist.co/staff/105981/) before the group disbanded in 2017.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Frima - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Soldier EG - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Tiara - Fairy Fencer F (VG)

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/siglic)

**Shigeru Morita** is a Japanese script/screenwriter.

**Height:** 153 cm (5'0)

__[Profile (Osawa)](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/kayanoai/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayanoai_0913) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kayanoai_0913/) | [YouTube Channel Official Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kayanomi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0D6qi-Gr5RW7hqOvTEKmAw)__

__Introduction:__
Ai Kayano is a Japanese voice actress and vocalist currently affiliated with Office Osawa.

__Biography:__
Kayano wanted to work in a job that would involve "healing people", leading to initially take up a course at a vocational school. She worked in the beauty industry and became interested in acting after having seen [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/). While attending school, Kayano continued working in the industry and paid for her tuition.

Kayano began working at Pro-Fit in 2010, voicing two supporting characters in the original video animation [Princess Resurrection](https://anilist.co/anime/9159/). In 2011, she voiced [Meiko "Menma" Honma](https://anilist.co/character/40592/) in [Anohana](https://anilist.co/anime/9989/) and received the Best Rookie Actress award for said role at the 6th Seiyuu Awards. Kayano, [Haruka Tomatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/95890/) and [Saori Hayami](https://anilist.co/staff/95869/) performed the series' ending theme "Secret Base – Kimi ga Kureta Mono (10 years after Ver.)", a cover of a song originally sung by the band Zone.

She is often praised for her vocal range, having voiced a variety of characters such as [Mayaka Ibara](https://anilist.co/character/55137/), [Mashiro Shiina](https://anilist.co/character/61371/), [Darkness](https://anilist.co/character/89363/) and [Akari Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/character/24311/) for example, none of which one would connect to the same voice actress.

**Trivia:**
- Worked part-time at a coffee shop with [Chinatsu Akasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/107652/) before becoming a voice actress.
- She got around 100 suggestions for her nickname in the Anohana radio show, from which she herself picked out Kayanon.

Non-anime roles:
- Atago - Azur Lane
- Graf Zeppelin - Azur Lane
- Kaga - Azur Lane
- Renown - Azur Lane
- Y'shtola Rhul - Final Fantasy XIV

__Height:__ 167 cm

Tomisiro (stylized TOMISIRO) is a Japanese music production group consisting of Naoyuki Honzawa and Yoske Kakegawa.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/SUZUKi_SAEKo?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor)

Saeko Suzuki is a Japanese singer, drummer and musical composer. She was part of the Japanese New Wave / Pop scene in the 1980s. She took a hiatus in her career when she wanted to focus on raising her child, but came back to work in the industry in 2004, working on projects like Sgt. Frog and many others.

__Currently living:__ Saitama Prefecture, Japan

Kantoku is an illustrator, artist, and key illustrator born March 26, 1985. He established, and is currently active in his own circle, 5nen me no Houkago (5年目の放課後, lit. 5th Year's After School).
